abstract: David Hilder, an analyst with Susquehanna Financial, says that Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley may considering changing their status as bank holding companies as a result of the Volcker Rule, Bloomberg News reports.
snippet: David Hilder, an analyst with Susquehanna Financial, says that Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley may considering changing their status as bank holding companies as a result of the Volcker Rule, Bloomberg News reports.
lead_paragraph: David Hilder, an analyst with Susquehanna Financial, says that Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley may considering changing their status as bank holding companies because of the Volcker Rule, Bloomberg News reports. The rule, Mr. Hilder wrote, represents "a massive new compliance burden on banks to prove that their market-making activities are just that, and not proprietary trading in disguise." Other analysts are skeptical either bank would try. Read more »

headline.main: Could Goldman and Morgan Stanley Shed Bank Status?
